DESCRIPTION:

Verifies that a citizen cannot vote twice on the same proposal.

## Security
Prevents vote manipulation by ensuring one-vote-per-citizen per proposal.

DESCRIPTION:
## Purpose
Verifies that only the backend wallet can create proposals - unauthorized accounts are rejected.

This is a critical access control test ensuring the bridge cannot be abused.

Transaction fails with "Only backend wallet" error.

NAME: test_proposal_created_event_emitted

DESCRIPTION: The Groth16 verifier expects b coordinates in swapped order: b[i][1], b[i][0] instead of b[i][0], b[i][1]. This test verifies the swap is applied.
NAME: should handle proof b coordinate swap correctly
should return false for invalid proof

DESCRIPTION:

Verifies that all citizens in the DAO are verified in the verified-accounts contract.

For every account in the DAO citizen role, is_account_verified() == true.

DESCRIPTION:
## Purpose
Verifies that a verified citizen can successfully vote on a proposal.

## Flow
1. User gets verified through verified-accounts
2. User is added as citizen through bridge
3. Backend creates a proposal
4. Citizen votes on the proposal

## Expected
Vote transaction succeeds.
NAME: test_citizen_can_vote_on_proposal

DESCRIPTION:
## Purpose
Verifies that VoteReject from a single citizen results in Rejected status.

## Expected
With only 1 citizen voting reject, proposal status becomes Rejected.

DESCRIPTION:
## Purpose
Verifies that the bridge can still query verification status from the verified-accounts
contract when it is paused, because read operations (like is_account_verified) are
allowed even when the contract is paused.

## Test 4.1.4 - bridge_handles_verification_contract_pause

## Scenario
1. User is verified before pause
2. Verified-accounts contract is paused
3. Bridge calls add_member (which queries is_account_verified)
4. Verification check succeeds because reads work when paused
NAME: test_bridge_handles_verification_contract_pause

DESCRIPTION: Verifies that store_verification rejects ZK proof with public_signals array exceeding maximum length of 21.

NAME: should use correct NEP-413 tag (2^31 + 413)

DESCRIPTION:
## Purpose
Verifies the complete happy path for storing a verified account with real ED25519 cryptographic signatures.

## Preconditions
- Backend wallet is configured as contract owner
- User has a valid ED25519 keypair
- NEP-413 signature is properly formatted and valid

## Expected Behavior
1. Verification is stored without panic
2. Account is marked as verified
3. Verified count increments to 1
4. `verification_stored` event is emitted with correct JSON format
5. Account data is retrievable with correct nullifier
NAME: test_happy_path_store_verification

DESCRIPTION: Documents serialization behavior for WeightOrRatio::Ratio with zero denominator. This dangerous edge case (potential division-by-zero) is allowed at the type level. Consuming DAO contracts must validate that Ratio denominators are non-zero.
NAME: test_weight_or_ratio_zero_denominator_serialization

## Purpose
Verifies that VersionedVerification enum discriminants remain constant for record migration.

- If VersionedVerification::V1 discriminant changes, existing records become unreadable
- Lazy migration relies on correctly deserializing V1 records

## Expected Values
- V1: 0x00

DESCRIPTION:
## Purpose
Verifies that StorageKey enum discriminants remain constant across contract versions.
These discriminants are used as storage prefixes for NEAR SDK collections.

## Why This Matters
- If StorageKey::Nullifiers changes from 0x00 to 0x01, all existing nullifiers become orphaned
- This is a **silent data corruption** bug - contract deploys but data is lost
- Borsh uses enum declaration order to assign discriminants (0x00, 0x01, 0x02...)

## Expected Values
- Nullifiers: 0x00
- Accounts: 0x01
NAME: test_storage_key_discriminants_are_stable
rejects uppercase 0X prefix
SUB SUITE: NEAR Account Validation > ethImplicitAccountSchema > invalid ETH-implicit accounts
